3#ifndef _TLS_H_INCLUDED_
4#define _TLS_H_INCLUDED_
5
6/*++
7/* NAME
8/* tls 3h
9/* SUMMARY
10/* libtls internal interfaces
11/* SYNOPSIS
12/* #include <tls.h>
13/* DESCRIPTION
14/* .nf
15
16 /*
17 * Utility library.
18 */
19#include <name_code.h>
20#include <argv.h>
21
22 /*
23 * TLS enforcement levels. Non-sentinel values may also be used to indicate
24 * the actual security level of a session.
25 *
26 * XXX TLS_LEV_NOTFOUND no longer belongs in this list. The SMTP client will
27 * have to use something else to report that policy table lookup failed.
28 *
29 * The order of levels matters, but we hide most of the details in macros.
30 *
31 * "dane" vs. "fingerprint", both must lie between "encrypt" and "verify".
32 *
33 * - With "may" and higher, TLS is enabled.
34 *
35 * - With "encrypt" and higher, TLS encryption must be applied.
36 *
37 * - Strictly above "encrypt", the peer certificate must match.
38 *
39 * - At "dane" and higher, the peer certificate must also be trusted. With
40 * "dane" the trust may be self-asserted, so we only log trust verification
41 * errors when TA associations are involved.
42 */
43#define TLS_LEV_INVALID -2 /* sentinel */
44#define TLS_LEV_NOTFOUND -1 /* XXX not in policy table */
45#define TLS_LEV_NONE 0 /* plain-text only */
46#define TLS_LEV_MAY 1 /* wildcard */
47#define TLS_LEV_ENCRYPT 2 /* encrypted connection */
48#define TLS_LEV_FPRINT 3 /* "peer" CA-less verification */
49#define TLS_LEV_HALF_DANE 4 /* DANE TLSA MX host, insecure MX RR */
50#define TLS_LEV_DANE 5 /* Opportunistic TLSA policy */
51#define TLS_LEV_DANE_ONLY 6 /* Required TLSA policy */
52#define TLS_LEV_VERIFY 7 /* certificate verified */
53#define TLS_LEV_SECURE 8 /* "secure" verification */
54
55#define TLS_REQUIRED(l) ((l) > TLS_LEV_MAY)
56#define TLS_MUST_MATCH(l) ((l) > TLS_LEV_ENCRYPT)
57#define TLS_MUST_TRUST(l) ((l) >= TLS_LEV_HALF_DANE)
58#define TLS_MUST_PKIX(l) ((l) >= TLS_LEV_VERIFY)
59#define TLS_OPPORTUNISTIC(l) ((l) == TLS_LEV_MAY || (l) == TLS_LEV_DANE)
60#define TLS_DANE_BASED(l) \
61 ((l) >= TLS_LEV_HALF_DANE && (l) <= TLS_LEV_DANE_ONLY)
62#define TLS_NEVER_SECURED(l) ((l) == TLS_LEV_HALF_DANE)
63
64extern int tls_level_lookup(const char *);
65extern const char *str_tls_level(int);
66
67#ifdef USE_TLS
68
69 /*
70 * OpenSSL library.
71 */
72#include <openssl/lhash.h>
73#include <openssl/bn.h>
74#include <openssl/err.h>
75#include <openssl/pem.h>
76#include <openssl/x509.h>
77#include <openssl/x509v3.h>
78#include <openssl/rand.h>
79#include <openssl/crypto.h> /* Legacy SSLEAY_VERSION_NUMBER */
80#include <openssl/opensslv.h> /* OPENSSL_VERSION_NUMBER */
81#include <openssl/ssl.h>
82
83 /* Appease indent(1) */
84#define x509_stack_t STACK_OF(X509)
85#define general_name_stack_t STACK_OF(GENERAL_NAME)
86#define ssl_cipher_stack_t STACK_OF(SSL_CIPHER)
87#define ssl_comp_stack_t STACK_OF(SSL_COMP)
88
89#if (OPENSSL_VERSION_NUMBER < 0x00090700f)
90#error "need OpenSSL version 0.9.7 or later"
91#endif
92
93 /* Backwards compatibility with OpenSSL < 1.1.0 */
94#if OPENSSL_VERSION_NUMBER < 0x10100000L
95#define OpenSSL_version_num SSLeay
96#define OpenSSL_version SSLeay_version
97#define OPENSSL_VERSION SSLEAY_VERSION
98#define X509_up_ref(x) \
99 CRYPTO_add(&((x)->references), 1, CRYPTO_LOCK_X509)
100#define EVP_PKEY_up_ref(k) \
101 CRYPTO_add(&((k)->references), 1, CRYPTO_LOCK_EVP_PKEY)
102#define X509_STORE_CTX_get0_cert(ctx) ((ctx)->cert)
103#define X509_STORE_CTX_get0_untrusted(ctx) ((ctx)->untrusted)
104#define X509_STORE_CTX_set0_untrusted X509_STORE_CTX_set_chain
105#define X509_STORE_CTX_set0_trusted_stack X509_STORE_CTX_trusted_stack
106#define ASN1_STRING_get0_data ASN1_STRING_data
107#define X509_getm_notBefore X509_get_notBefore
108#define X509_getm_notAfter X509_get_notAfter
109#endif
110
111/* SSL_CIPHER_get_name() got constified in 0.9.7g */
112#if OPENSSL_VERSION_NUMBER >= 0x0090707fL /* constification */
113#define SSL_CIPHER_const const
114#else
115#define SSL_CIPHER_const
116#endif
117
118/* d2i_X509() got constified in 0.9.8a */
119#if OPENSSL_VERSION_NUMBER >= 0x0090801fL
120#define D2I_const const
121#else
122#define D2I_const
123#endif

125 /*
126 * Utility library.
127 */
128#include <vstream.h>
129#include <name_mask.h>
130#include <name_code.h>
131
132 /*
133 * TLS library.
134 */
135#include <dns.h>
136
137 /*
138 * Names of valid tlsmgr(8) session caches.
139 */
140#define TLS_MGR_SCACHE_SMTPD "smtpd"
141#define TLS_MGR_SCACHE_SMTP "smtp"
142#define TLS_MGR_SCACHE_LMTP "lmtp"
143
144 /*
145 * RFC 6698 DANE
146 */
147#define TLS_DANE_TA 0 /* Match trust-anchor digests */
148#define TLS_DANE_EE 1 /* Match end-entity digests */
149
150#define TLS_DANE_CERT 0 /* Match the certificate digest */
151#define TLS_DANE_PKEY 1 /* Match the public key digest */
152
153#define TLS_DANE_FLAG_NORRS (1<<0) /* Nothing found in DNS */
154#define TLS_DANE_FLAG_EMPTY (1<<1) /* Nothing usable found in DNS */
155#define TLS_DANE_FLAG_ERROR (1<<2) /* TLSA record lookup error */
156
157#define tls_dane_unusable(dane) ((dane)->flags & TLS_DANE_FLAG_EMPTY)
158#define tls_dane_notfound(dane) ((dane)->flags & TLS_DANE_FLAG_NORRS)
159
160#define TLS_DANE_CACHE_TTL_MIN 1 /* A lot can happen in ~2 seconds */
161#define TLS_DANE_CACHE_TTL_MAX 100 /* Comparable to max_idle */
162
163 /*
164 * Certificate and public key digests (typically from TLSA RRs), grouped by
165 * algorithm.
166 */
167typedef struct TLS_TLSA {
168 char *mdalg; /* Algorithm for this digest list */
169 ARGV *certs; /* Complete certificate digests */
170 ARGV *pkeys; /* SubjectPublicKeyInfo digests */
171 struct TLS_TLSA *next; /* Chain to next algorithm */
172} TLS_TLSA;
173
174 /*
175 * Linked list of full X509 trust-anchor certs.
176 */
177typedef struct TLS_CERTS {
178 X509 *cert;
179 struct TLS_CERTS *next;
180} TLS_CERTS;
181
182 /*
183 * Linked list of full EVP_PKEY trust-anchor public keys.
184 */
185typedef struct TLS_PKEYS {
186 EVP_PKEY *pkey;
187 struct TLS_PKEYS *next;
188} TLS_PKEYS;
189
190typedef struct TLS_DANE {
191 TLS_TLSA *ta; /* Trust-anchor cert/pubkey digests */
192 TLS_TLSA *ee; /* End-entity cert/pubkey digests */
193 TLS_CERTS *certs; /* Full trust-anchor certificates */
194 TLS_PKEYS *pkeys; /* Full trust-anchor public keys */
195 char *base_domain; /* Base domain of TLSA RRset */
196 int flags; /* Lookup status */
197 time_t expires; /* Expiration time of this record */
198 int refs; /* Reference count */
199} TLS_DANE;
200
201#define TLS_DANE_HASTA(d) ((d) ? (d)->ta : 0)
202#define TLS_DANE_HASEE(d) ((d) ? (d)->ee : 0)
203
204 /*
205 * tls_dane.c
206 */
207extern int tls_dane_avail(void);
208extern void tls_dane_flush(void);
209extern void tls_dane_verbose(int);
210extern TLS_DANE *tls_dane_alloc(void);
211extern void tls_dane_add_ee_digests(TLS_DANE *, const char *, const char *,
212 const char *);
213extern void tls_dane_free(TLS_DANE *);
214extern TLS_DANE *tls_dane_resolve(unsigned, const char *, DNS_RR *, int);
215extern int tls_dane_load_trustfile(TLS_DANE *, const char *);
216
217 /*
218 * TLS session context, also used by the VSTREAM call-back routines for SMTP
219 * input/output, and by OpenSSL call-back routines for key verification.
220 *
221 * Only some members are (read-only) accessible by the public.
222 */
223#define CCERT_BUFSIZ 256
224
225typedef struct {
226 /* Public, read-only. */
227 char *peer_CN; /* Peer Common Name */
228 char *issuer_CN; /* Issuer Common Name */
229 char *peer_cert_fprint; /* ASCII certificate fingerprint */
230 char *peer_pkey_fprint; /* ASCII public key fingerprint */
231 int peer_status; /* Certificate and match status */
232 const char *protocol;
233 const char *cipher_name;
234 int cipher_usebits;
235 int cipher_algbits;
236 /* Private. */
237 SSL *con;
238 char *cache_type; /* tlsmgr(8) cache type if enabled */
239 int ticketed; /* Session ticket issued */
240 char *serverid; /* unique server identifier */
241 char *namaddr; /* nam[addr] for logging */
242 int log_mask; /* What to log */
243 int session_reused; /* this session was reused */
244 int am_server; /* Are we an SSL server or client? */
245 const char *mdalg; /* default message digest algorithm */
246 /* Built-in vs external SSL_accept/read/write/shutdown support. */
247 VSTREAM *stream; /* Blocking-mode SMTP session */
248 /* RFC 6698 DANE trust input and verification state */
249 const TLS_DANE *dane; /* DANE TLSA digests */
250 int errordepth; /* Chain depth of error cert */
251 int tadepth; /* Chain depth of trust anchor */
252 int errorcode; /* First error at error depth */
253 X509 *errorcert; /* Error certificate closest to leaf */
254 x509_stack_t *untrusted; /* Certificate chain fodder */
255 x509_stack_t *trusted; /* Internal root CA list */
256} TLS_SESS_STATE;
257
258 /*
259 * Peer status bits. TLS_CERT_FLAG_MATCHED implies TLS_CERT_FLAG_TRUSTED
260 * only in the case of a hostname match.
261 */
262#define TLS_CERT_FLAG_PRESENT (1<<0)
263#define TLS_CERT_FLAG_ALTNAME (1<<1)
264#define TLS_CERT_FLAG_TRUSTED (1<<2)
265#define TLS_CERT_FLAG_MATCHED (1<<3)
266#define TLS_CERT_FLAG_SECURED (1<<4)
267
268#define TLS_CERT_IS_PRESENT(c) ((c) && ((c)->peer_status&TLS_CERT_FLAG_PRESENT))
269#define TLS_CERT_IS_ALTNAME(c) ((c) && ((c)->peer_status&TLS_CERT_FLAG_ALTNAME))
270#define TLS_CERT_IS_TRUSTED(c) ((c) && ((c)->peer_status&TLS_CERT_FLAG_TRUSTED))
271#define TLS_CERT_IS_MATCHED(c) ((c) && ((c)->peer_status&TLS_CERT_FLAG_MATCHED))
272#define TLS_CERT_IS_SECURED(c) ((c) && ((c)->peer_status&TLS_CERT_FLAG_SECURED))
273
274 /*
275 * Opaque client context handle.
276 */
277typedef struct TLS_APPL_STATE TLS_APPL_STATE;
278
279#ifdef TLS_INTERNAL
280
281 /*
282 * Log mask details are internal to the library.
283 */
284extern int tls_log_mask(const char *, const char *);
285
286 /*
287 * What to log.
288 */
289#define TLS_LOG_NONE (1<<0)
290#define TLS_LOG_SUMMARY (1<<1)
291#define TLS_LOG_UNTRUSTED (1<<2)
292#define TLS_LOG_PEERCERT (1<<3)
293#define TLS_LOG_CERTMATCH (1<<4)
294#define TLS_LOG_VERBOSE (1<<5)
295#define TLS_LOG_CACHE (1<<6)
296#define TLS_LOG_DEBUG (1<<7)
297#define TLS_LOG_TLSPKTS (1<<8)
298#define TLS_LOG_ALLPKTS (1<<9)
299
300 /*
301 * Client and Server application contexts
302 */
303struct TLS_APPL_STATE {
304 SSL_CTX *ssl_ctx;
305 int log_mask;
306 char *cache_type;
307 char *cipher_exclusions; /* Last cipher selection state */
308 char *cipher_list; /* Last cipher selection state */
309 int cipher_grade; /* Last cipher selection state */
310 VSTRING *why;
311};
312
313 /*
314 * tls_misc.c Application-context update and disposal.
315 */
316extern void tls_update_app_logmask(TLS_APPL_STATE *, int);
317extern void tls_free_app_context(TLS_APPL_STATE *);
318
319 /*
320 * tls_misc.c
321 */
322extern void tls_param_init(void);
323
324 /*
325 * Protocol selection.
326 */
327#define TLS_PROTOCOL_INVALID (~0) /* All protocol bits masked */
328
329#ifdef SSL_TXT_SSLV2
330#define TLS_PROTOCOL_SSLv2 (1<<0) /* SSLv2 */
331#else
332#define SSL_TXT_SSLV2 "SSLv2"
333#define TLS_PROTOCOL_SSLv2 0 /* Unknown */
334#undef SSL_OP_NO_SSLv2
335#define SSL_OP_NO_SSLv2 0L /* Noop */
336#endif
337
338#ifdef SSL_TXT_SSLV3
339#define TLS_PROTOCOL_SSLv3 (1<<1) /* SSLv3 */
340#else
341#define SSL_TXT_SSLV3 "SSLv3"
342#define TLS_PROTOCOL_SSLv3 0 /* Unknown */
343#undef SSL_OP_NO_SSLv3
344#define SSL_OP_NO_SSLv3 0L /* Noop */
345#endif
346
347#ifdef SSL_TXT_TLSV1
348#define TLS_PROTOCOL_TLSv1 (1<<2) /* TLSv1 */
349#else
350#define SSL_TXT_TLSV1 "TLSv1"
351#define TLS_PROTOCOL_TLSv1 0 /* Unknown */
352#undef SSL_OP_NO_TLSv1
353#define SSL_OP_NO_TLSv1 0L /* Noop */
354#endif
355
356#ifdef SSL_TXT_TLSV1_1
357#define TLS_PROTOCOL_TLSv1_1 (1<<3) /* TLSv1_1 */
358#else
359#define SSL_TXT_TLSV1_1 "TLSv1.1"
360#define TLS_PROTOCOL_TLSv1_1 0 /* Unknown */
361#undef SSL_OP_NO_TLSv1_1
362#define SSL_OP_NO_TLSv1_1 0L /* Noop */
363#endif
364
365#ifdef SSL_TXT_TLSV1_2
366#define TLS_PROTOCOL_TLSv1_2 (1<<4) /* TLSv1_2 */
367#else
368#define SSL_TXT_TLSV1_2 "TLSv1.2"
369#define TLS_PROTOCOL_TLSv1_2 0 /* Unknown */
370#undef SSL_OP_NO_TLSv1_2
371#define SSL_OP_NO_TLSv1_2 0L /* Noop */
372#endif
373
374#ifdef SSL_TXT_TLSV1_3
375#define TLS_PROTOCOL_TLSv1_3 (1<<5) /* TLSv1_3 */
376#else
377#define SSL_TXT_TLSV1_3 "TLSv1.3"
378#define TLS_PROTOCOL_TLSv1_3 0 /* Unknown */
379#undef SSL_OP_NO_TLSv1_3
380#define SSL_OP_NO_TLSv1_3 0L /* Noop */
381#endif
382
383#define TLS_KNOWN_PROTOCOLS \
384 ( TLS_PROTOCOL_SSLv2 | TLS_PROTOCOL_SSLv3 | TLS_PROTOCOL_TLSv1 \
385 | TLS_PROTOCOL_TLSv1_1 | TLS_PROTOCOL_TLSv1_2 )
386#define TLS_SSL_OP_PROTOMASK(m) \
387 ((((m) & TLS_PROTOCOL_SSLv2) ? SSL_OP_NO_SSLv2 : 0L) \
388 | (((m) & TLS_PROTOCOL_SSLv3) ? SSL_OP_NO_SSLv3 : 0L) \
389 | (((m) & TLS_PROTOCOL_TLSv1) ? SSL_OP_NO_TLSv1 : 0L) \
390 | (((m) & TLS_PROTOCOL_TLSv1_1) ? SSL_OP_NO_TLSv1_1 : 0L) \
391 | (((m) & TLS_PROTOCOL_TLSv1_2) ? SSL_OP_NO_TLSv1_2 : 0L) \
392 | (((m) & TLS_PROTOCOL_TLSv1_3) ? SSL_OP_NO_TLSv1_3 : 0L))
393
394/*
395 * SSL options that are managed via dedicated Postfix features, rather than
396 * just exposed via hex codes or named elements of tls_ssl_options.
397 */
398#define TLS_SSL_OP_MANAGED_BITS \
399 (SSL_OP_CIPHER_SERVER_PREFERENCE | TLS_SSL_OP_PROTOMASK(~0))
400
401extern int tls_protocol_mask(const char *);
402
403 /*
404 * Cipher grade selection.
405 */
406#define TLS_CIPHER_NONE 0
407#define TLS_CIPHER_NULL 1
408#define TLS_CIPHER_EXPORT 2
409#define TLS_CIPHER_LOW 3
410#define TLS_CIPHER_MEDIUM 4
411#define TLS_CIPHER_HIGH 5
412
413extern const NAME_CODE tls_cipher_grade_table[];
414
415#define tls_cipher_grade(str) \
416 name_code(tls_cipher_grade_table, NAME_CODE_FLAG_NONE, (str))
417#define str_tls_cipher_grade(gr) \
418 str_name_code(tls_cipher_grade_table, (gr))
419
420 /*
421 * Cipher lists with exclusions.
422 */
423extern const char *tls_set_ciphers(TLS_APPL_STATE *, const char *,
424 const char *, const char *);
425
426#endif
427
428 /*
429 * tls_client.c
430 */
431typedef struct {
432 const char *log_param;
433 const char *log_level;
434 int verifydepth;
435 const char *cache_type;
436 const char *cert_file;
437 const char *key_file;
438 const char *dcert_file;
439 const char *dkey_file;
440 const char *eccert_file;
441 const char *eckey_file;
442 const char *CAfile;
443 const char *CApath;
444 const char *mdalg; /* default message digest algorithm */
445} TLS_CLIENT_INIT_PROPS;
446
447typedef struct {
448 TLS_APPL_STATE *ctx;
449 VSTREAM *stream;
450 int timeout;
451 int tls_level; /* Security level */
452 const char *nexthop; /* destination domain */
453 const char *host; /* MX hostname */
454 const char *namaddr; /* nam[addr] for logging */
455 const char *serverid; /* Session cache key */
456 const char *helo; /* Server name from EHLO response */
457 const char *protocols; /* Enabled protocols */
458 const char *cipher_grade; /* Minimum cipher grade */
459 const char *cipher_exclusions; /* Ciphers to exclude */
460 const ARGV *matchargv; /* Cert match patterns */
461 const char *mdalg; /* default message digest algorithm */
462 const TLS_DANE *dane; /* RFC 6698 verification */
463} TLS_CLIENT_START_PROPS;
464
465extern TLS_APPL_STATE *tls_client_init(const TLS_CLIENT_INIT_PROPS *);
466extern TLS_SESS_STATE *tls_client_start(const TLS_CLIENT_START_PROPS *);
467
468#define tls_client_stop(ctx, stream, timeout, failure, TLScontext) \
469 tls_session_stop(ctx, (stream), (timeout), (failure), (TLScontext))
470
471#define TLS_CLIENT_INIT(props, a1, a2, a3, a4, a5, a6, a7, a8, a9, \
472 a10, a11, a12, a13) \
473 tls_client_init((((props)->a1), ((props)->a2), ((props)->a3), \
474 ((props)->a4), ((props)->a5), ((props)->a6), ((props)->a7), \
475 ((props)->a8), ((props)->a9), ((props)->a10), ((props)->a11), \
476 ((props)->a12), ((props)->a13), (props)))
477
478#define TLS_CLIENT_START(props, a1, a2, a3, a4, a5, a6, a7, a8, a9, \
479 a10, a11, a12, a13, a14, a15) \
480 tls_client_start((((props)->a1), ((props)->a2), ((props)->a3), \
481 ((props)->a4), ((props)->a5), ((props)->a6), ((props)->a7), \
482 ((props)->a8), ((props)->a9), ((props)->a10), ((props)->a11), \
483 ((props)->a12), ((props)->a13), ((props)->a14), ((props)->a15), (props)))
484
485 /*
486 * tls_server.c
487 */
488typedef struct {
489 const char *log_param;
490 const char *log_level;
491 int verifydepth;
492 const char *cache_type;
493 int set_sessid;
494 const char *cert_file;
495 const char *key_file;
496 const char *dcert_file;
497 const char *dkey_file;
498 const char *eccert_file;
499 const char *eckey_file;
500 const char *CAfile;
501 const char *CApath;
502 const char *protocols;
503 const char *eecdh_grade;
504 const char *dh1024_param_file;
505 const char *dh512_param_file;
506 int ask_ccert;
507 const char *mdalg; /* default message digest algorithm */
508} TLS_SERVER_INIT_PROPS;
509
510typedef struct {
511 TLS_APPL_STATE *ctx; /* TLS application context */
512 VSTREAM *stream; /* Client stream */
513 int fd; /* Event-driven file descriptor */
514 int timeout; /* TLS handshake timeout */
515 int requirecert; /* Insist on client cert? */
516 const char *serverid; /* Server instance (salt cache key) */
517 const char *namaddr; /* Client nam[addr] for logging */
518 const char *cipher_grade;
519 const char *cipher_exclusions;
520 const char *mdalg; /* default message digest algorithm */
521} TLS_SERVER_START_PROPS;
522
523extern TLS_APPL_STATE *tls_server_init(const TLS_SERVER_INIT_PROPS *);
524extern TLS_SESS_STATE *tls_server_start(const TLS_SERVER_START_PROPS *props);
525extern TLS_SESS_STATE *tls_server_post_accept(TLS_SESS_STATE *);
526
527#define tls_server_stop(ctx, stream, timeout, failure, TLScontext) \
528 tls_session_stop(ctx, (stream), (timeout), (failure), (TLScontext))
529
530#define TLS_SERVER_INIT(props, a1, a2, a3, a4, a5, a6, a7, a8, a9, \
531 a10, a11, a12, a13, a14, a15, a16, a17, a18, a19) \
532 tls_server_init((((props)->a1), ((props)->a2), ((props)->a3), \
533 ((props)->a4), ((props)->a5), ((props)->a6), ((props)->a7), \
534 ((props)->a8), ((props)->a9), ((props)->a10), ((props)->a11), \
535 ((props)->a12), ((props)->a13), ((props)->a14), ((props)->a15), \
536 ((props)->a16), ((props)->a17), ((props)->a18), ((props)->a19), (props)))
537
538#define TLS_SERVER_START(props, a1, a2, a3, a4, a5, a6, a7, a8, a9, a10) \
539 tls_server_start((((props)->a1), ((props)->a2), ((props)->a3), \
540 ((props)->a4), ((props)->a5), ((props)->a6), ((props)->a7), \
541 ((props)->a8), ((props)->a9), ((props)->a10), (props)))

566extern void tls_stream_stop(VSTREAM *);
567
568 /*
569 * tls_bio_ops.c: a generic multi-personality driver that retries SSL
570 * operations until they are satisfied or until a hard error happens.
571 * Because of its ugly multi-personality user interface we invoke it via
572 * not-so-ugly single-personality wrappers.
573 */
574extern int tls_bio(int, int, TLS_SESS_STATE *,
575 int (*) (SSL *), /* handshake */
576 int (*) (SSL *, void *, int), /* read */
577 int (*) (SSL *, const void *, int), /* write */
578 void *, int);
579
580#define tls_bio_connect(fd, timeout, context) \
581 tls_bio((fd), (timeout), (context), SSL_connect, \
582 NULL, NULL, NULL, 0)
583#define tls_bio_accept(fd, timeout, context) \
584 tls_bio((fd), (timeout), (context), SSL_accept, \
585 NULL, NULL, NULL, 0)
586#define tls_bio_shutdown(fd, timeout, context) \
587 tls_bio((fd), (timeout), (context), SSL_shutdown, \
588 NULL, NULL, NULL, 0)
589#define tls_bio_read(fd, buf, len, timeout, context) \
590 tls_bio((fd), (timeout), (context), NULL, \
591 SSL_read, NULL, (buf), (len))
592#define tls_bio_write(fd, buf, len, timeout, context) \
593 tls_bio((fd), (timeout), (context), NULL, \
594 NULL, SSL_write, (buf), (len))
595
596 /*
597 * tls_dh.c
598 */

601extern int tls_set_eecdh_curve(SSL_CTX *, const char *);
